channel.title: NPCdrop help
channel.description:
Can anybody explain droptype for me? Someone said you should put a percentage here, but I don't think that's true, can anyone help? Sorry if this sounds a little newbish, but I havn;t really done that much on private servers.
Also. can any on something else. How do I make it so that the server knows which shop to use when you talk to certain NPC's?

item.title: NPCdrop help
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

TY, by the way, I’m getting this error;


:: Server Compiling
::
::Results:
NPCHandler.java:718: cannot find symbol
symbol  : method randomDS0()
location: class Item3
ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randomDS0(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, Ge
tNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
                         ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
:: Done!
Press any key to continue . . .

after adding this bit;

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1615) {
ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randomAbbyssal(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}

I added the first bit and it was fine. Anyone?

Read full topic

Also. can any on something else. How do I make it so that the server knows which shop to use when you talk to certain NPC’s?[/quote]

wait a min il get you my tutorial on how to add
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,208083.0.html

Read it
helps alot if you want to add % of drops

item.title: NPCdrop help
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

yh i suppose i could

public static int Abbyssal[] = {4151,592,592,592,592}; public static int randomAbbyssal() { return Abbyssal[(int)(Math.random()*Abbyssal.length)]; }
The abyssal demon has a 1 in 5 chance of dropping the whip with that code. That is the item3.java and below is the npchandler.java

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1615) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randomAbbyssal(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }
Voila!

Read full topic

item.description:

OK, that helps a lot. Could you do me one last favour though? Could you show them three codes above setup for abby demon to drop whip. So I can get an idea how to set it up? Thanks, Syr.

item.title: NPCdrop help
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

DS0 is the code ID so that each peice of code can talk to the other one and know what to use the number ‘691’ in the first code is the item id(s)

item.title: NPCdrop help
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Not sure I get that, can you elaborate? Is this just NPCdrop? Is DSO the item ID? Also how do I change the chance of getting the item.

Read full topic

item.title: NPCdrop help
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

you need to add something like this:
Open up item3.java and add this anywhere BUT NOT IN AN ALREADY EXISTING DROP

public static int DS0[] = {691}; public static int randomDS0() { return DS0[(int)(Math.random()*DS0.length)]; }
Where it says DS0 that is the identification change htis to whatever you want the number is the item it will drop ok? you can have as many or as few as you like then open up NPC Handler and add this:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 298) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randomDS0(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }
now before i show you where to add this the number above is the NPC id and the DS0 is the identification which must match the first bit. Add that under

int NPCID2 = NPCID+34; System.out.println("Npc id =" +NPCID); if(npcs[NPCID] != null && server.playerHandler.players[Play] != null && server.playerHandler.players[GetNpcKiller(NPCID)] != null) { if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 80) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); ItemHandler.addItem(4206, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

Read full topic
